On Nov 20, 2008, at 8:39 AM, Nick Gall wrote:

> Let's take GData, a "specialization" of APP. GData is used for a  
> wide variety of applications at Google -- including Google Doc,  
> Google Spreadsheet, and Google Calendar. Google is trying the make  
> the interfaces into all of its apps as unified and generic as  
> possible. This happens when one relentlessly asks: how are these  
> applications the same? For example, how is a spreadsheet like a  
> calendar?
>


Since APP is just an application of HTTP to the Atom Syndication  
Format, is this about using an application neutral payload format for  
representations? If so, would you call SOAP (the envelope format)  
application neutral?

I am not saying this is good or bad, but trying to understand your use  
of "application neutrality".

Subbu
